posts.description: An Admin's Foolish Errors Helped the FBI Unmask Child Porn Site 'Playpen' | Motherboard
posts.extended: Sites hosted on the so-called dark web are forcing law enforcement to use novel and powerful techniques to unmask them. But sometimes suspected criminals make it easier for the feds.

On Wednesday night, current and former Gawker Media employees gathered at the company’s Manhattan headquarters to celebrate 14 years of independent journalism ahead of a court-advised sale next week. One former editor, A.J. Daulerio, however, was not in attendance.

posts.description: The Strange Origins of TrueCrypt, ISIS’s Favored Encryption Tool - The New Yorker
posts.extended: On Tuesday, the Times reporter Rukmini Callimachi published the latest in a series of blockbuster stories about the inner workings of the Islamic State.
